Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2018 06:45AM Krysm7 wrote: good morning Jkv924. Was there any mention of a BIRADS score from your ultrasound. That is usually a helpful hint.
Posts.Title: Breast biopsy tomorrow--question about underarm pain? Jkv924 Jkv924

Posts.Content: Krysm7 wrote: have had a terrible headache since chemo 8 days ago. It got worse last night and started vomiting this morning so went to my cancer clinic this morning. They have me an IV and some dexamethasone. Didn’t touch headache. Also did a ct to rule anything out there. My neuts are 0.4 White are 1.6 Plates 206 No fever They ended up having to send me to emergency for further investigation. I sat there for over 3 hours to see a doctor. I asked if I could just try some sumatriptan that I’ve had in past for migraines. They kept telling me could be something more severe. So it was okay to let me suffer for hours just incase. So now ER doctor, who I’ve heard gets excited about doing lumbars, wants to go straight to a lumbar. No more blood work, no other tests straight to lumbar. If I refuse lumbar I go on 3 antibiotics. Any advice?? Dx 6/8/2018, IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 1/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/18/2018 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Chemotherapy 8/14/2018 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 11/13/2018 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 1/7/2019 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone else need lumbar to rule out neutrapena? Krysm7 Krysm7

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2018 06:27AM Krysm7 wrote: thanks Notverybrav! I did exit. Signed consents, and got out of there. My oncologist thinks migraines as well. Have an appt with him next week. He wants to talk about changing treatment. Good to know that yours being reduced worked. I think that may be his plan as well. I ended up back in hospital last night for dehydration and more miagrsine injections. Felt some relief today. Praying for a sleep filled painfree night. Haven’t had more than 4 hours sleep a night since day 1.
Posts.Title: Anyone else need lumbar to rule out neutrapena? Krysm7 Krysm7

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2018 04:59PM Krysm7 wrote: I feel exactly the same as Ingerp. I had a hard time trying to wrap my head around why I needed chemo, except I did have one node involved which apparently makes chemo a given. But I definitely don’t want to have any “would haves” or “should haves” if this ever comes back. I think that feeling for me would be worse than the chemo. You need to decide what you’re gut is telling you. There’s also tons of success stories from people who skiped chemo and did a natural route.
Posts.Title: Factors when deciding whether to do chemo or not? maiyen JNKK

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2018 02:16AM Krysm7 wrote: thanks so much for the reply Moth. I’ve asked several times if I can just go home for the night to think about all this. And he just keeps trying to bully me into the lumbar. I have no fever, no stiff neck. Just a simple really bad headache that I’ve had since chemo day but keeps getting worse. I thought I was just coming today for headache meds. I did finally get some miagrsine drugs and headaches is definitely felt getting better. What I really want to do is go home for the night. Talk to my oncologist tomorrow. See what he suggests. I would understand the urgency for antibiotics if I had a fever.
Posts.Title: Anyone else need lumbar to rule out neutrapena? Krysm7 Krysm7

Posts.Content: Krysm7 wrote: hi everyone. New to this forum. Have been reading through topics and this is such an informative group with amazing people in it. I found a lump last Friday. Sent for Mam and US. Tech told me after US that would need biopsy. Yesterday was biopsy, which wasn't too bad for what is was. The only thing I really know is US findings were birad score of 5. I was shocked. After all that I've read, I'm guessing I should be ready for a cancer diagnosis? I know there still that 5% chance..but feeling that "why would I be so special"... Anyone here with a score of 5 but benign result? Dx 6/8/2018, IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 1/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/18/2018 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Chemotherapy 8/14/2018 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 11/13/2018 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 1/7/2019 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Log in to post a reply
